title: Tristana's Rocket Jump is one of the most overpowered abilities in the whole game
body: The being able to jump out of stuns part is absolutely game changing. Game changing in an unfair way, in my last ranked game I was playing Rakan and I can't even tell you how many times I R,w combo and she rocket jumped as she was charmed away also making my knock up miss every time. Now i've never played Tris but it almost seems like she can cast her jump as shes getting CC'd,

replies.body: she can also eat CC while mid jump. can't tell you how wonderful it feels when your playing blitz and you pull her mid jump to her death

Basically how to counter this ability in a nutshell ^

CC her in mid jump not when she starts it.
Yeah, maybe works in bronze but in high elo nope.
Alright relax tough guy, funny to hear you say that when you're in bronze 1 yourself.

> [{quoted}](name=Ventra117,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=REgd80TT,comment-id=000000000000,timestamp=2017-11-06T00:49:16.483+0000)
>
> Yeah, maybe works in bronze but in high elo nope.

But it works on pros too. Timing is a high elo technique too
In challenger they will save the jump after the hook.
Sure, if the hook is the only CC available.

In challenger, they will also no to bait the jump, or maybe force it by E'ing first lol

Or just not give her a chance to use it
no. lmfao. There is a reason blitz isn't the go to trist counter in challenger.
No, but if you pick blitz before Trist, you have to take what you're given, and you have to know how to play the matchup.
Sry I forgot challengjour players like you can dodge skillshots even mid-air.
Only works for displacements. Stuns, snares, charms, fears, everything else will still allow her to complete the jump.
{{champion:81}} ok{{champion:98}} lets{{champion:429}} nerf{{champion:89}}  everyone{{champion:19}} who{{champion:111}} does{{champion:6}} this.{{champion:59}}
you forgot everyone else with a movement ability in the game. ALso camille is super easy to pull off .

Im pretty sure {{champion:89}} ~~has the power of god and anime on her side~~ becomes a beam of light, while {{champion:6}} & {{champion:19}}  are the type of guys who eats hard CC for breakfast. ({{champion:111}} can be added here as well)

also:{{champion:98}} Ninja who can enter the twilight realm (Possible excuse)

{{champion:81}}: Magic ( No real excuse here really)

{{champion:429}} Dead ( also no real excuse)
yeah i'm just kinda annoyed by them only focusing tristy when it's all over league.
It's probably because Tristana is strong right now; If she was weak like she was earlier in the season this thread probably wouldn't exist.

She isn't _"super strong"_. She currently has a worse kit than what she had when she was the 15th Worst ADC in the game.

You didn't know/notice?

Wanna know what's strong? Wanna know what changed exactly?
**Crit Items** became really good. Tristana is designed to spike around 35 mins, but because how good the IE+Shiv combo is, she's spiking at 20 - 25 mins, so of course she feels _"strong"_ but it's not her: **It's her Items**.

There's a reason all Crit users are so good right now. See Draven, see Twitch, there's Xayah, and even Vayne/Cait have seen a rise in play rate just because these items are so good. Cait's kit right now is in a really awkward and even weak state some may say, but she stays somewhat playable because of the items.

I know that it's crit items that are strong, I never said that her kit was the issue. All I was trying to say was that she's just a good pick, and people are trying to find ways to get her nerfed even when it isn't her kit that is the issue.
I like how you didnt include {{champion:59}} who is already massively hated for this interaction

######SHH MY JARMAN
at least jarmans states it in his ability description and costs two spells.
######edited
Its not tristana's w op. Its just how dashes interact with hard cc ( expect displacements).

This **AGAIN**???

**Every single champion with a dash you may channel can do this, and Tristana has been like this for YEARS and NOBODY HAD EVER COMPLAINED ABOUT IT the way people seem to be fishing for it nowadays**.
Buffering the jump correctly is an expression of skill. Do it wrong and you're gonna die. Do it too early and you'll still be pulled. Do it too late and you'll still get knocked up.

Displacements outright **cancel** her jump if you time it properly. Any good Thresh player will tell you how you can bait the jump, walk up to her and interrupt it midway.

Finally, here's a quote from **Riot jinxylord** on the topic:
> We could certainly nerf Trist jump to be interrupted by CC but that would likely make the spell feel pretty awful to use, **the vast majority of dashes in our game cannot be canceled in that way** and I'm not sure Trist's W should be uniquely bad in that regard considering it has a .5 second cast time. We could lower the cast time (or remove it completely), but that would likely make her mobility overall STRONGER.

> This is due to cast-time buffering. To compensate for things like network lag, spells in League that have cast times are favored to go off (even if you are stunned during said cast time). This does create some frustrating experiences where you land your hook on Trist and she just bounces out of it, but on the flip side, if the spell were instant, that hook would have never landed in the first place.
Trist's W is strong to be sure, but it having a cast time makes it a good degree weaker. Better she's stunned after jumping away from you than never stunned at all.

> To get into what I mean by "network lag compensation," imagine you're playing against Riven (who has an instant stun with no cast time, enabling it to preempt your cast times) and Annie (who's Q stuns after a travel time). If you push Q at the same time Annie does, both of your spells will go off, as her stun takes a bit to reach you. If you push Q at the same time as Riven stun, it's very possible that (based on latency) Riven's stun will go off slightly before your spell. If this happens, not only will you be stunned, but you will be left wondering why your spell didn't go off. You pushed the button when you weren't stunned, and yet the spell failed to cast. Makes the game feel clunky and unresponsive, and at times will cause players to do things they don't want to (like continue running into a fight after the stun wears off because they thought they had cast their dash/ult/fight turner which would have made them stop for a cast time and change their trajectory).

> These types of interactions are one of the reasons silences (especially instant ones like Raka E) feel so bad in our game. They have poor feedback that something has happened, and so players attempt to cast their spells, don't get a result, run places they don't want since there was no cast time to stop them, and then come out of it feeling like the game is laggy and unresponsive.

Now, move on and let this thing go.
Enough is enough with the Tristana hate.

Saying no one has ever complained about it is a dead lie, you only need to look at oh, this very post to see that.

People have been wanting (rightfully so) to remove the CC buffer on Trist and Ez since they realize they have had them.  Squishy ADCs who are supposed to position (and by extension use their positioning tools) so that they aren't in range of skillshots and CC shouldn't be able to just ignore CC that actually hits them, because reasons ???, and still get away and do damage at the same time.
Do I literally have to re-quote what I just quoted from Jinxylord?? Are you not reading or do you not understand the very simple things already explained on the post?

Well, I mean rightfully or not people have been complaining about Tristana and this mechanic as long as I can remember. I agree that it's probably best to just leave it go, bit at the same time I also understand the frustration, even outside of Tristana.

If one of these champions is excelling, they're going to draw attention to the mechanic, which will draw people to complain because while it DOES feel crappy, it's probably the lesser of two evils at this point.

It does this because it has a cast time. Multiple dashes do, but you can't really change it without drastically changing the champ. 

If you remove the cast time, it becomes a safer, even more op skill and she can use it faster than before. If you make the cast time longer, she has even more time to buffer cc.

I think rocket jump and Trist are fine. To fix her, just fix her items. Trist was among the worst ADCs in the game before her items got cheaper and better.
Alternatively, change it from a cast into a channel that has to be completed before the dash goes off, so any CC blocks it.
Are there any channeled dashes in the game? That seems super unreliable on an ADC..or any champ in general.
Shyvana's R used to work like that. Any CC ever would stop you. And if Shyvana, a bruiser with no other gapcloser, had it (before getting CC immunity during the dash), it would be *fine* on an ADC.
Is it still working like that???
The reason they changed it is BECAUSE it was horrible lmao that's why they won't make that mistake again
It was horrible on a melee champion with no other way to gapclose. It would be fine on an ADC that gets more range with levels.

No it wouldnt. It would feel horrible to use, and it would cuck her so hard early and late when staying alive matters.

People are only even complaining about her because she's strong right now, and she's only strong right now because of crit being dumb. Her kit on it's own is actually pretty bad, if not worse than what it used to be.

> It would feel horrible to use, and it would cuck her so hard early and late when staying alive matters.

That's the point. ADCs shouldn't be as safe as Tristana is. People are only complaining about her because she's the FotM marksman who only became busted not because of any buffs to her kit but because her counters were nerfed. It's like a game of musical chairs because the entire role is composed of champions who do nothing but statcheck. They're just as problematic as old Ryze was.
ADCs are supposed to be the safest class, next to mages. They also scale the hardest. The problem right now, is that they scale the fastest out of all the classes.
The fact that they're supposed to both be the safest and hardest scaling class is the fundamental problem with them.

It makes perfect sense. You protect them, so they can remain safe and scale up, so that when they do scale, they shred everything. The problem is, they scale too fast. Once we get them back to scaling later like after two or three items, then the game is fine again. Late game champs shouldn't be hitting late game at 19 min.
{{champion:81}} who needs a map

It is a jump with a super long channel time. 

Look at it this way - she only gets hit because her jump takes so long to cast. If it casted instantly like {{champion:236}} for example, then she just wouldnt get hit at all. 

The stun does less because shes animation locked into jumping anyway, but its still better than no stun at all. Presumably. At least you get to hit her.
All abilities with a cast time can do this. See Lux R, Veigar E, Tristana W, Urgot E, etc...
Not Lux's R, at least. That very much can be interrupted by CC
I mean yeah, if you consider death to be aCC
Silences interrupt it, stuns interrupt it, displacements interrupt it.

Lux's R will not be interrupted unless she dies in the cast time.

She can be moved from the original position and the laser will still fire from where she started it.
Thanks for stealing my spotlight. I was gonna look smart saying this too D:
oops
I cant believe someone TrashAtThisGame knows this but you don't
It annoys me how she can just jump into a fight, do some damage then just jumps over a wall or away where u can't CC her.

> The being able to jump out of stuns part is absolutely game changing. 

Any jump does that which you'd know if you didn't came here just to exaggerate and shitpost.
